sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"事故，事件"之意。
means: accident ：强调偶然或意外发生的不幸事情。
incident ：既可指小事件或附带事件，又可指政治上具有影响的事件或事变。
event ：可指任何大小事件，但尤指历史上的重大事件。
occurrence和happening这两个词多指日常生活中发生的一般事件，有时也指偶然发生的事。

sentence.Network_en: The birth of a live healthy baby is a truly blessed event.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个健康活泼的婴儿的出生真是一件可喜的事情。

sentence.Network_en: The event will go ahead as planned in Sheffield next summer.
sentence.Network_cn: 这项活动将按计划于明年夏天在谢菲尔德举行。

sentence.Network_en: Olga Korbut single-handedly turned gymnastics into a major event.
sentence.Network_cn: 奥尔佳·科布特独自一人将体操变成了一项重要赛事。

lj.lj_ly: this will reduce the chance of serious injury in the event of an accident.
lj.lj_ls: 如果发生意外事故，这会减少重伤的可能性。

lj.lj_ly: in the event that an attack is launched, the defenders will have been significantly weakened by air attacks.
lj.lj_ls: 如果发动攻击，空中打击将使防卫者的防卫能力大大减弱。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 如果是那样的话；在那种情况下

lj.lj_ly: in that event, the US would incline toward a lifting of the arms embargo.
lj.lj_ls: 在那种情况下，美国可能会取消武器禁运。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 在任何情况下，不管怎样
在任何情况下，不管怎样

jx.jx_en_mean: If it should happen; in case.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin eventus, from evenire 'result, happen', from e- (variant of ex-) 'out of' + venire 'come'

encyclopedia.content: 防水材料 eVENT，目前世界上最优异的防水材料之一，属于高性能的ePTFE膜的一种，表膜中含有数以万计的毛细透气孔，这些透气孔比水滴小1万倍，比气体分子大700倍，在防水的同时，又具备了良好的透气性。GORE-TEX的顶级系列GORE-TEX XCR透气性能为每天每平米1500~4000克，视内外湿度变化而变化。而无论内外湿度差距多大，eVENT的透气性能为每天每平米5300克。 eVENT防水透气面料技术说明 eVENT防水纺织品技术通过经久耐用的表膜来排

entry.tran: 事件;（尤指）特殊事件，重大事件
entry.def: An event is something that happens, especially when it is unusual or important. You can use events to describe all the things that are happening in a particular situation.

example.ex: ...in the wake of recent events in Europe...
example.tran: 紧随欧洲最近发生的大事之后

entry.tran: （社交聚会、体育比赛等有计划、有组织的）活动
entry.def: An event is a planned and organized occasion, for example a social gathering or a sports match.

example.ex: The cross-country section of the three-day event was held here yesterday.
example.tran: 3日比赛中的越野项目昨天在这里举行。

entry.def: An event is one of the races or competitions that are part of an organized occasion such as a sports meeting.

example.ex: A solo piper opens Aberdeen Highland Games at 10am and the main events start at 1pm.
example.tran: 上午10点，一位风笛独奏家揭开了阿伯丁高地运动会的序幕，下午1点主要比赛项目开始。

entry.tran: 万一发生…；如果是那样子的话；假若…
entry.def: You use in the event of ,in the event that, and in that event when you are talking about a possible future situation, especially when you are planning what to do if it occurs.

example.ex: The bank has agreed to give an immediate refund in the unlikely event of an error being made...
example.tran: 万一出现错误——虽然这种几率微乎其微，银行同意立即退款。

example.ex: In the event that any part of the deal may be blocked, the rest would go ahead.
example.tran: 万一交易的某一部分受阻，其他部分将继续进行。

entry.def: You say in any event after you have been discussing a situation, in order to indicate that what you are saying is true or possible, in spite of anything that has happened or may happen.

example.ex: In any event, the bowling alley restaurant proved quite acceptable.
example.tran: 无论如何，那个保龄球场的餐厅证明还是很不错的。

entry.def: You say in the event after you have been discussing what could have happened in a particular situation, in order to indicate that you are now describing what actually did happen.

example.ex: 'Don't underestimate us', Norman Willis warned last year. There was, in the event, little danger of that.
example.tran: “别低估了我们，”诺曼·威利斯去年警告说。结果，什么事也没有。

means.word_mean: 1. something that happens at a given place and time

sentences.sentence: "in that event, the first possibility is excluded"
"it may rain in which case the picnic will be canceled"

means.word_mean: 3. a phenomenon located at a single point in space-time; the fundamental observational entity in relativity theory
4. a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon;

sentences.sentence: "the magnetic effect was greater when the rod was lengthwise"
"his decision had depressing consequences for business"
"he acted very wise after the event"

auth_sentence.content: Firearms are ubiquitous and assassinations are a regular event.
auth_sentence.res_content: Firearms are ubiquitous and assassinations are a regular event.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Firearms are ubiquitous and assassinations are a regular event.

auth_sentence.content: He revealed he had considered withdrawing from the event.
auth_sentence.res_content: He revealed he had considered withdrawing from the event.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He revealed he had considered withdrawing from the event.

auth_sentence.content: The atmosphere at the test event was really good.
auth_sentence.res_content: The atmosphere at the test event was really good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The atmosphere at the test event was really good.

Sentence.sentence: To raise money for a forthcoming local sports event.
To enhance his credibility with the audience, Larry had brought some slides of his family attending sports events.
Covering major events of the day in the city.

sentences.en: Next day the newspapers reported the event.
sentences.cn: 第二天, 报纸报道了这个事件。

sentences.en: Events proved the folly of such calculations.
sentences.cn: 事情的进展证明了这种估计是愚蠢的。

sentences.en: The authorities were unable to control events.

sentences.cn: 约2000名运动员参加了20个项目的比赛。

jushi.english: We had an animated discussion over current events last evening.
jushi.chinese: 昨天晚上我们热烈地讨论时事。
这难道不是一件惊人的事件吗?

jushi.english: It was quite an event when a woman first became prime minister.
jushi.chinese: 妇女首次当上了首相的确是件大事。
